January 1: This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it. - Psalm 118:24
January 2: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight. - Proverbs 3:5-6
January 3: I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me. - Philippians 4:13
January 4: Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God’s will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will. - Romans 12:2
January 5: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope. - Jeremiah 29:11
January 6: Let all that you do be done in love. - 1 Corinthians 16:14
January 7: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. - Psalm 23:1
January 8: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest. - Matthew 11:28
January 9: Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you. - 1 Peter 5:7
January 10: Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you. - Ephesians 4:32
January 11: And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose. - Romans 8:28
January 12: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. - Psalm 46:1
January 13: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life. - John 3:16
January 14: Commit to the Lord whatever you do, and he will establish your plans. - Proverbs 16:3
January 15: For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, love, and self-discipline. - 2 Timothy 1:7
January 16: But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint. - Isaiah 40:31
January 17: The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid? - Psalm 27:1
January 18: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness. - 1 John 1:9
January 19: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit. - Romans 15:13
January 20: Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.' - John 14:6
January 21: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and he helps me. My heart leaps for joy, and with my song I praise him. - Psalm 28:7
January 22: I sought the Lord, and he answered me; he delivered me from all my fears. - Psalm 34:4
January 23: For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord. - Romans 8:38-39
January 24: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control. Against such things there is no law. - Galatians 5:22-23
January 25: Delight yourself in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart. - Psalm 37:4
January 26: But the Lord is faithful, and he will strengthen you and protect you from the evil one. - 2 Thessalonians 3:3
January 27: Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth. - Psalm 46:10
January 28: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God. - Matthew 5:9
January 29: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with my loving eye on you. - Psalm 32:8
January 30: The Lord is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold. - Psalm 18:2
January 31: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding. - Proverbs 9:10

July 20: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight. - Proverbs 3:5-6
July 21: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it. - Psalm 118:24
July 22: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing. He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, he refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his name’s sake. - Psalm 23:1-3
July 23: And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose. - Romans 8:28
July 24: But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint. - Isaiah 40:31
July 25: The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid? - Psalm 27:1
July 26: This is the day the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it. - Psalm 118:24
July 27: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit. - Romans 15:13
July 28: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and he helps me. My heart leaps for joy, and with my song I praise him. - Psalm 28:7
July 29: Delight yourself in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart. - Psalm 37:4
July 30: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding. - Proverbs 9:10
July 31: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope. - Jeremiah 29:11
